title: Trump's Iran gamble fraught with risk - at home and abroad
summary: The article highlights the potential risks associated with Trump's actions regarding Iran, including the possibility of retaliation against US troops and internal political dissent.  The situation poses significant geopolitical risks and may lead to heightened tensions in the Middle East.

title: What we know about US strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities

title: Israel says it killed Iran's military co-ordinator with Hamas

title: Hot air balloon incident kills eight in Brazil
summary: A hot air balloon accident in Brazil resulted in eight fatalities.  A fire onboard reportedly caused the pilot to attempt an emergency landing.  The incident highlights potential safety risks associated with hot air balloon tourism.

title: Nigerian communities to take Shell to high court over oil pollution
summary: Residents of Bille and Ogale in the Niger Delta, Nigeria, are suing Shell and a subsidiary for oil pollution, with the trial set for 2027.  The case involves significant environmental damage and highlights ongoing tensions between multinational corporations and local communities in the region. The outcome could have implications for future environmental litigation against oil companies.

title: Ordinary Zambians lose out twice: to global looting and local corruption | Letters
summary: The Guardian article highlights significant illicit financial flows from Zambia due to multinational corporations exploiting its resources in concert with corrupt insiders.  This results in billions of dollars in lost revenue for Zambia, dwarfing US aid cuts.  The authors argue that the US aid cut justification is misleading given the larger scale of the problem.

title: Woman dies of rabies in Yorkshire after contact with dog in Morocco
summary: A British woman, Yvonne Ford, died from rabies in Yorkshire after contact with a stray dog in Morocco.  This highlights the risk of rabies exposure from animal contact in some regions and the need for preventative measures like vaccination. The UKHSA confirmed the diagnosis.
